description:
Smith Haughey opened our Ann Arbor office on North Main Street in 2002. The firm had been looking to expand to the eastside of the state for some time and was delighted when Ed Stein chose to join the firm and head up that office. In 2005, we moved to the newly renovated Schwaben Building. The four-story, 22,000-square-foot building has been a fixture on Ashley Street since 1915. Today, the University of Michigan Health System and Trinity Health are two of the clients served by attorneys in the Ann Arbor office.

About Ann Arbor

Family recreation, breathtaking scenery or just unabashed fun, can all be found in Ann Arbor. With a bustling downtown and charming tree-lined neighborhoods, Ann Arbor is a safe and ideal place to live, learn, work, and raise a family. More than 114,000 residents live within the citys 27 square miles, and Ann Arbor regularly receives national attention as one of the best places to live in the United States.

People are drawn to Ann Arbor for its eclectic urban setting blended harmoniously with acres of trees. This unique contrast offers something for everyone. The cosmopolitan college town boasts fine to casual dining and world-class shopping in nationally known stores and boutiques with local flair. Action-packed sporting events come courtesy of the University of Michigan. Endless opportunities for recreation are available in the Ann Arbor area, which includes 156 parks with trails, golf courses, canoe liveries, tennis courts, athletic fields and more. Cultural experiences, including museums, galleries and performing arts centers, make Ann Arbor a destination for arts aficionados of any age.

Ann Arbor is a hub of excellence in education and has five colleges and universities, including the University of Michigan. The citys acclaimed public school system has adopted a comprehensive academic achievement plan to help ensure all students are successful. One of the most environmentally friendly cities around, Ann Arbor has a progressive recycling program and takes great pride in its preservation of the citys green space. With a rich history, diverse character, and kinetic feeling, Ann Arbor is a magnificent place to experience.
